result.execSummary:
The defendant Quincy L Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia
No violent or abusive contact with the victim 
Not to physically discipline any children

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate
Cooperate with Social Services if involved

records.addlTxt: Denying Sentence Modification and Granting Sentence Credit

Defendant Quincy L Allen by phone with attorney Mark R Thompson. Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Wisconsin, State of. Defense filed motion for post conviction relief for modification of sentence and additional sentence credit. State opposes sentence modification. Court denies motion for sentence modification. Court approves motion for sentence credit to read 201 days total, JOC to be amended.
